bioghist.p: Lucille Wallower (1910-1999) was born in Waynesboro, Pennsylvania, and studied at Pennsylvania Museum School of Art and the Traphagen School of Fashion. Her first book, Nanka of Old Bohemia, was published in 1937 and her first self-illustrated book, A Conch Shell for Molly, was published in 1940. From the 1930s to the 1970s she worked as a children's librarian in Pennsylvania. She continued writing throughout her career as a librarian, and in 1975, she began to work full-time as a writer and illustrator. Wallower published over 40 works, many of which include her own illustrations. Many of her works focus on the history and geography of Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of manuscripts and illustrations of Lucille Wallower. Materials include typescripts, galley proofs, color separations, and final art for a number of Wallower's books, including A Conch Shell for Molly, The Hippity Hopster, The Morning Star, Old Satan, Your Pennsylvania, and My Book about Abraham Lincoln. Also included in the collection are notes and a series of 36 lithographs from A Conch Shell for Molly.
